dmca.title: Infringement of Copyright
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: flower delivery london [mailto:flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com] 
Sent: Friday, February 23, 2007 4:35 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: Re: FW: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3062051H] Infringement of Copyright

On 2/19/07, Copyright <copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:
> To Whom It May Concern:
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.
>
> Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringement%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
>
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: flower delivery london [mailto:flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com]
> Sent: Monday, February 19, 2007 3:21 AM
> To: Copyright
> Subject: Re: FW: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3062051H] Infringement of Copyright
>
> Dear Legal Response Team
>
> The complaint is copyright.
>
> Have you Looked at the web sites ?
> Have you Looked at the sorces code ?
>
> The complaint is not the domain name, but the web site it self.
> The complaint is not the Trademark.
>
> The disputed material is not the domain name.
>
> The web site was copied, buy looking out our source code of our web
> site flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk  you will see that.
>
> From your email you say that "we are compelled by Federal Law to
> disable access of website if it infringes copyright "
> flowersdeliveredlondon.com  has done that.
>
> Thay copied our website and the sorces code, removed our name.
>
> We have also contacted the web company who designed the website for us,
> to contact you .
>
>
>
> Sincerely,
>
> flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk
>
>
>
> On 2/16/07, Copyright <copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:
> > The disputed material in the below-pasted complaint is the domain name, not the
content of the website. As an ISP, we are compelled by Federal Law to disable
access of website if it infringes copyright or trademark rights of third
parties. This is not the case since the website www.flowersdeliveredlondon.com
neither uses the Trademark flowerdeliverylondon on his website nor has
flowerdeliverylondon content display there. As the disputed material is the
domain name and it is not under our control, because it was not registered with
us. This issue should be resolved either by the registrar of the domain name
flowersdeliveredlondon.com or ICANN.
> >
> > Legal Response Team
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: flower delivery london [mailto:flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com]
> > Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2007 7:04 PM
> > To: Copyright
> > Subject: Re: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3062051H] Infringement of Copyright
> >
> > Dear theplanet.com
> >
> > This person that has copied or website  with the domain name
> > http://www.flowersdeliveredlondon.co.uk
> >
> > also perchesed http://www.flowersdeliveredlondon.com and is hosting
> > the copied website on your web servers.
> >
> > In the UK we contacted http://www.nominet.org.uk/ about this within 3
> > days of seeing unusual activity on our servers showing HTTrack Website
> > Copier. They saw that this was
> > a direct copy of our web site and contacted the owner of the domain name.
> >
> > The site had been removed by that person.
> >
> > Now he is using a .com name and clearly does not want to be found by
> > registering
> > with SilentRegister.info who we have also contacted.
> >
> > Now all that we are asking is that you look into this as it clearly
> > shows that he has
> > chose you theplanet.com to host a copied website.
> >
> >
> >
> > Sincerely,
> >
> > flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk
> >
> >
> >
> > On 2/14/07, Copyright <copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:
> > > To Whom It May Concern:
> > >
> > > Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
> > >
> > > Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.
> > >
> > > Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringement%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
> > >
> > > Legal Response Team
> > > THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com]
> > > Sent: Tuesday, February 13, 2007 4:27 AM
> > > To: Copyright
> > > Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3062051H] Infringement of Copyright
> > >
> > > ==== Forwarded Ticket ====
> > > 1. Infringement of Copyright
> > > Added by system at Tuesday, Feb 13 2007 10:23 am
> > > X-MailFrom: flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com
> > > X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net
> > > Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for
<abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net>; Tue Feb 13 10:23:45 2007
> > > Received: (qmail 1667 invoked by alias); 13 Feb 2007 16:23:45 -0000
> > > Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net
> > > Received: (qmail 1664 invoked from network); 13 Feb 2007 16:23:45 -0000
> > > Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com (70.87.6.111)
> > >   by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 13 Feb 2007 16:23:45 -0000
> > > Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com
with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830);
> > >   Tue, 13 Feb 2007 10:23:45 -0600
> > > Return-path: <flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com>
> > > Delivery-date: Tue, 13 Feb 2007 10:23:45 -0600
> > > Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181]
helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com)
> > >  by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com)
> > >  with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256)
> > >  (Exim)
> > >         id 1HH0RV-0003Ho-AZ
> > >         for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 13 Feb 2007 10:23:45 -0600
> > > Received: from wr-out-0506.google.com ([64.233.184.239])
> > >         by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from
flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com)
> > >         with esmtp (Exim)
> > >         id 1HH0RI-0002LD-3t
> > >         for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 13 Feb 2007 10:23:32 -0600
> > > Received: by wr-out-0506.google.com with SMTP id i28so2201911wra
> > >         for <abuse@theplanet.com>; Tue, 13 Feb 2007 08:23:28 -0800 (PST)
> > > DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; c=nofws;
> > >         d=gmail.com; s=beta;
> > >         h=received:message-id:date:from:to:subject:mime-version:content-type:content-transfer-encoding:content-disposition;
> > >         b=qejFeEkNock8emJTb70WsclNMUAwr90jzr5v4HKY14HIJQCj1qTtgVS6pDOX7r7bu9YbYJQyUREw1/Z5WM/NyEKkI2hzhn3WXQfcvCPnMTgO5jucaa9v71++wDYRsuRJ9hBQEa72r4rmWa+dBf2CCxNrCDK2Nql29x6/r5NT+Z0=
> > > Received: by 10.114.12.9 with SMTP id 9mr7841458wal.1171383802950;
> > >         Tue, 13 Feb 2007 08:23:22 -0800 (PST)
> > > Received: by 10.114.145.9 with HTTP; Tue, 13 Feb 2007 08:23:22 -0800 (PST)
> > > Message-ID: <ef2297580702130823k62666d52lcda2bb459b435379@mail.gmail.com>
> > > Date: Tue, 13 Feb 2007 16:23:22 +0000
> > > From: "flower delivery london" <flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com>
> > > To: abuse@theplanet.com
> > > Subject: Infringement of Copyright
> > > MIME-Version: 1.0
> > > Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
> > > Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
> > > Content-Disposition: inline
> > > Received-SPF: pass (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: domain of gmail.com designates
64.233.184.239 as permitted sender) client-ip=64.233.184.239;
envelope-from=flowerdeliverylondon@gmail.com; helo=wr-out-0506.google.com;
> > > X-OriginalArrivalTime: 13 Feb 2007 16:23:45.0506 (UTC)
FILETIME=[5564B420:01C74F8B]
> > >
> > > MIME element (text/plain)
> > > Dear theplanet.com
> > >
> > > It has come to my attention that you have made an unauthorized use of
> > > my copyrighted work entitled [www.flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk] (the
> > > "Work") in the preparation of a work derived therefrom. I have
> > > reserved all rights in the Work, which was first published in 2005 on
> > > http://www.flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk, and I have registered the
> > > copyright.
> > >
> > > Your work entitled flowersdeliveredlondon.com and which appears on
> > > your web site at http://www.flowersdeliveredlondon.com, is essentially
> > > identical to the Work and clearly used the Work as its basis.
> > >
> > >
> > > You neither asked for nor received permission to use the Work as the
> > > basis for [flowerdeliverylondon.co.uk] nor to make or distribute
> > > copies of it. Therefore, I believe you have willfully infringed my
> > > rights under 17 USC
